abstract.p: Judith Judson letter on Bruce Barcott's June 4 review of David Roberts' book True Summit: What Really Happened on the Legendary Ascent of Annapurna notes neither Louis Lachenal nor Maurice Herzog might have survived if heart specialist Jacques Oudot had not given up his chance at summit8

block.p: Bruce Barcott's commentary on ''True Summit: What Really Happened on the Legendary Ascent of Annapurna'' (June 4), by David Roberts, is extremely interesting. What is left unsaid in the review, however, is that neither Louis Lachenal nor Maurice Herzog might have survived to tell

his tale had not the distinguished heart specialist and intrepid mountaineer Jacques Oudot been part of the expedition. He gave up his own chance at the summit to safeguard his companions. Oudot's gallantry and integrity have never been in doubt.
